docs.title: Foldable Callouts
docs.text:
Are callouts foldable?

Yes! In a foldable callout, the contents are hidden when the callout is collapsed.

docs.title: Nested Callouts
docs.text:
Can callouts be nested?

Yes!, they can.

You can even use multiple layers of nesting.

docs.title: Document YAML FrontMatter
docs.text:
Important metadata settings

  • URL
  • creation/update date
  • document publication state
  • other metadata as needed for SEO

docs.title: Directory Metadata
docs.text:
• Must create a README.md file inside the directory

Possible metadata settings are ...

  • Dates are currently hardcoded and cannot be changed programmatically. Also, each file / blog post must have a different date - thus the %H:%M%S

  • Dates are also used by the pub-blog plugin for post ordering; as well as the meta plugin for updating a sitemap file

docs.title: Date
docs.text: date: 2023-05-19 15:40:36  # Use Python date format %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S

docs.title: Update
docs.text: update: 2023-06-12 14:16:52 # Same as above - %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text:
• Navigation is automatically generated.
  • Easiest way to change the order is to use a numbering system prefix for directory names, i.e. ...
    • 01 - Blog
    • 02 - Directory_1
    • 03 - Directory_2

To solve strange URLs and document titles use title and slug frontmatter.

docs.title: Title
docs.text: title: Document Title

docs.title: Slug
docs.text: slug: document-slug

docs.title: Document Publication Status
docs.text:
Three states ...

  • published
status: published

- appears in navigation
- can be linked to via the navigation
- will be visible on the generated web page
  • hidden
status: hidden

- will not appear in navigation
- page will be generated up `mkdocs build` command
- can be internally linked to
- can also be externally linked to via direct URL address
  • draft (default)
status: draft # default

- will not appear in navigation
- will not be generated at build time
- EXCEPTION
    - will be generated with the local `mkdocs serve` command

docs.title: Directory Publication Status
docs.text:
Directories require a README.md file with one of three status states listed in previous section. The same conditions apply as for documents.

NOTE - If no status is set for a directory, the default is published.

docs.title: Defaults
docs.text:
NOTE - if using the defaults, you don't need to add them to the mkdocs.yml file. If you want to change them, they need to be added to mkdocs.yml file.

plugins:
  - pub-meta:
      dir_meta.file: README.md
      slug:
        enable: true
        warn_on_missing: true  # used when MkDocs `strict mode` is switched on
        key_name: status
      status:
        search_in_hidden: false
        search_in_draft: false
        file_default: draft  # other choices are `published` and `hidden`
        file_warn_on_missing: true # for `strict mode`
        dir_default: published
        dir_warn_on_missing: false # for `strict mode'
        key_name: status
      title:
        key_name: title

docs.title: Pub-Blog Notes
docs.text:
This plugin auto-generates the following items outside of the docs directory ...

  • indexes
  • archives
  • categories
  • tags
  • pagination

docs.title: Date format
docs.text:
date: 2023-02-12 22:00:00
  • each date MUST be in this form; it is hardcoded and not configurable at this time
  • each post must have a different date for the ordering to work correctly

docs.title: Default Configuration of pub-blog Plugin
docs.text:
• if using the defaults, you don't need to add them to the mkdocs.yml file. If you want to change them, they need to be added to mkdocs.yml file.
plugins:
  - pub-blog:
      teaser_marker: `<!-- more -->`
      searchable_non_posts: false
      posts_per_page: 5
      slug: blog
      temp_dir: .temp
      archive_subdir: archive
      categories_subdir: categories
      tags_subdir: tags
      lang: 'en'

docs.title: Included Obsidian Features
docs.text:
• Callouts
  • Wikilinks for internal links
  • automatic Backlinks
  • Vega Charts

More supported Obsidian plugins are being planned.

  • Obsidian vault needs to be created inside the docs directory
  • add the hidden .obsidian directory to the .gitignore file
  • create _templates/ directory inside docs directory

docs.title: Configuration of pub-obsidian Plugin
docs.text:
Again, these are the defaults ... only need to be added to mkdocs.yml if using non-default values.

plugins:
  - pub-obsidian:
      obsidian_dir: .obsidian
      templates_dir: _templates
    backlinks:
      enabled: true
    callouts:
      enabled: true
      indentation: spaces
    links:
      wikilinks_enabled: true
      img_lazy: true
    vega:
      enabled: true
      vega_schema: https://vega.github.io/schema/vega/v5.json
      vega_lite_schema: https://vega.github.io/schema/vega-lite/v5.json

docs.title: Pub-Social Plugin Notes
docs.text:
• This plugin's main purpose is for SEO Open Graph and Twitter metadata.
  • Not possible to autogenerate at this time
    • can add image as a preview w/ additional description, etc.

docs.title: Global Document Metadata
docs.text:
NOTE - if a required key is missing, the social card will not be included on the web page.

  • title - document title (30-65 characters; required)
  • description - short description (120-350 characters; required)
  • 'image' - link to an image (1200x630 pixels; optional)

title: Your document title description: A short description of document content that encourage to read it image: /some/url/to/an/image.jpg

docs.title: Configuration of pub-social Plugin
docs.text:
Again - all defaults are not required to be in the mkdocs.yml file.

plugins:
  - pub-social:
      og:
        enabled: true
        locale: en_us
      twitter:
        enabled: true
        website: @website
        author: @author
      meta_keys:
        title_key: title
        description_key: description
        image_key: image

docs.title: Pub-Minifier Plugin Notes
docs.text:
This plugin deals with the optimzation of images and minification of css and javascript files.

This plugin's is also NOT installed by default.

NOTE - I don't plan to use images, or css or javascript, so I'm not going to worry about this plugins configuration at this time.

docs.title: Pub-Debugger Plugin Notes
docs.text:
Designed to be used to supply logs to the developer when submitting an issue.

DONT FORGET TO ADD THESE FILES TO THE .gitignore FILE.

ENSURE THERE IS NO PRIVATE DATA BEING SUBMITTED IN THE LOG FILES!!!

Three Modules

  • console logger
  • file logger
  • zip file generator

docs.title: Configuration of pub-debugger Plugin
docs.text:
plugins:
  - pub-debugger:
    console_log:
      enabled: true
      log_level: INFO
      show_code_link: false
      show_logger_name: true
      show_entry_time: true
      entry_time_format: "%H:%M:%S.%f"
      filter_logger_names: [ ]
    file_log:
      enabled: true
      log_level: DEBUG
      log_format: "[%(created).14s][%(levelname)-5.5s][%(project_path)s:%(lineno)d] %(message)s"
      remove_old_files: true
      filter_logger_names: [ ]
    zip_log:
      enabled: true
      remove_old_files: true
      add_pip_freeze: true

docs.title: My Current Build and Publish Workflow
docs.text:
This is my current workflow ...

  • Create a new empty repository on GitHub

In the LOCAL project folder ... (from the virtual environment ???)

git init
git add . # stages all files
git commit -m "first commit"
git branch -M main
git remote add origin https://github.com/$USER/Name-of-Newly-Created-Empty-Repo.git
git push -u origin main

From the Virtual Environment ...

docs.title: Is this first step necessary if I'm deploying using mkdocs gh-deploy???
docs.text:
• Build the site into the docs Directory
    • run mkdocs build
  • Deploy the site to GitHub Pages
    • run 'mkdocs gh-deploy'
